Reviews.Title: “How small is cheap?”
Reviews.Author: Dennis K
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in London for a week related to work. Workplace booked this hotel, so I had no say in it. Yes, it is inexpensive for the area, but there is a reason. Quite literally, the ceiling was higher than the room was wide. And when I sat on the loo, each shoulder touched the wall. This is the 21st century. Why would they have a 14" television mounted six feet off the floor that could only show 6 channels poorly? No drain plug in the tiny corner sink, quite dirty carpets. Just pathetic. I don't understand the arrogance of believing that this is anyway acceptable in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for the area, but that it's only redeeming quality.”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherLevy
Reviews.Content: I paid 80 pounds for a room which is not that bad for this area. But I think this is less than the normally charge. Having said that I will not stay there again. The TV remote did not work, the staff was not that pleasant and the "breakfast" consisited of cereal and pre-packaged cheese slices. For a much better option at a lower price ( 3 blocks away ) see my other review of a London lodging choice. I cannot advise staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay, Needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: traveller3132
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay, staff very friendly and toilets are clean. However, carpets need to be changed. I saw four rooms and in each one carpets had many stains. Staff at breakfast seem to be indifferent and slow. However, for the money, in central London its okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and our 2 young children stayed on several occassions in the family room. Great Location (Chelsea), friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “About everything wrong that can be.”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the dubious honor of visiting this establishment. We had an opportunity of transferring rooms though uppgrades until we were given the "best room in the hotel" ,room number 25. Unless you have a particular fondness of milldew I would advise you to stay away from this hotel. In the three rooms we lived in, none had a decent adjustment for the hot water in the shower. Consequently only scalding hot showers with diminishing pressure as we moved uppwards from ground level were available. As we moved the personell moved our stuff, "accidentaly misplacing" our brand new shampoos and conditioner, until we accused them of stealing. The constant moisture on in the carpets and the visible milldew on in the corners of the rooms eventually led to severe breathing difficulties. TV sets in all the rooms were old and the size of postage stamps. with hardly any channels visible;the ones that were, were adjusted to slight snowstorm. The generous complimentary 1 teabag per person were replenished by a once a day visit from the room service. Continental breakfast at Â£2.95 was watery coffee with marmelade and toast on the bottomfloor, where the beams had apparently given up, so that if someone walked past your table you spilt your coffee as the floor swayed. Luckily I had my loving wife with me and that kept up our spirits, otherwise we might have become a bit annoyed. We would recommend this hotel for masochists. Seriously we believe that a longer stay might damage your health. There is nothing wrong with the staff, they try their best but as two themselves admitted having never worked at a hotel before might be the reason for the quite tacky service.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: littlesheff
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel in November 2011. Room was very small and carpet very stained. Constant smell of damp. No hot water, shower not working properly. Taps and plug holes rusty. Reception supposed to be manned 24 hours but every time we went down, there was nobody there. So called continental breakfast was a few packets of cereal and some toast with some plastic cheese. If we had needed to stay more than one night we would have left.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go near it!”
Reviews.Author: Winston-shamu
Reviews.Content: Stayed in quadruple room on ground floor, it stank of damp, the ceiling was stained from a leak from upstairs room. Carpet disgusting, curtains not hooked up properly, net curtains black (should have been White) drawer had not been emptied from previous visitor - still had rubbish in. Bathroom floor tiles cracked, remote control for tv missing and had to ask twice for one. Better hotels for same money must be soooo very much better. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a tourist family not loking for fancy...”
Reviews.Author: jginbos
Reviews.Content: The family room at the Abcone is incredibly large by London standards. It is also clean with a modern and well equipped bathroom. As side note, a travel companion of ours stayed in a single room and it was only about big enough to fit the single bed that it contained. However, it was clean and the bed was comfortable and it had a good bathroom. It was actually all he needed. The hotel is not fancy, but the staff was very helpful and the price is right for a safe area which is very well located. The location was perfect. It is just a couple minute walk from the Gloucester Road tube station which has three tube lines. Those lines include the Piccadilly line which offers easy access to Heathrow. Also, if you enjoy walking, you can walk to many attractions such as Harods, Victoria and Albert Musuem, Natural History Museum, Science Museum, Kensington Park and Kensignton Palace and more. Other attraction are a quick tube ride away. My only complaint was that one of the Front Desk staff had terrible BO, which considering the lobby is very small, was inescapable and even hung around after he left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveladvisorNanaimo
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this comfortable hotel which is located just a short walk from Hyde Park. The staff were friendly and helpful; the room was larger than other hotels we had encountered in Europe, but still quite small. The footboard of the bed came to within five inches of the wall, making it difficult to reach the far side of the bed. I was pleased to finally find a decent hair dryer after staying in three other hotels that did not provide an adequate dryer. We had a pleasant view of the back garden, but were most impressed with our proximity to pubic transit, restaurants, laundromat and stores. The bed was comfortable and larger than we had encountered in other European hotels. There was no luggage rack provided, so I was forced to use the desk chair.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MaidinFargo
Reviews.Content: Given the bad to neutral reviews i read about this hotel as well as similar ones in Central London, i checked in with trepidation. But i was pleasantly surprised! First, I am still in the hotel, so this is a current/ongoing review. Check in time is 2pm but i got to the hotel by 7am and by 8am, i was in my room, i didn't have to wait. The hotel was fully booked, so i had to wait for someone to checkout and I was in! The receptionist was so friendly and helpful! The room (twin bed) is clean and bigger than i expected. It can't be compared to US rooms but looks modern. Relatively fast wifi, big dining room. Clean towels and bathroom, i am a neat freak. Didn't hear any noise from other rooms despite the hotel being full. Now the down side (hence the 4 star) include: (1) old small TV (2) no cable...in 21st century??? (3) No AC though i expected that from the reviews, but it has a fan. See pictures! All in all, i will stay here again and definitely recommend it to anyone interested.

Reviews.Title: “Not a wise choice”
Reviews.Author: engam
Reviews.Content: I have been relying on tripadvisor to choose hotels to stay, unfortunately this is not a good choice and luckily it was only for one night. I very seldom take pictures of hotel room as I have better things to do with my time, but in this case I felt so strongly I did. The hotel demanded full payment upon checkin. Often that is not a good sign. It became clear why once I got into my room - they were afraid I might leave immediately. The carpet was so soiled it gave the room unpleasant odour (see picture). Luckily I brought my own pair of slippers. The vanity top in the bathroom was heavily stained (see picture) The bath was mouldy (see picture). Bathroom amenities were just a small bar of soap and shampoo. There were strands of hairs in the drawers indicating housekeeping was not thorough in cleaning. The bed sheet was not big enough it could not be tucked under the mattress. There was an electric kettle and 2 cups, but you have to bring your own tea bags and sugar. The wifi was not working. There was no "do not disturb" sign provided and I heard people constantly knocking on my door while I was having a shower. I rang reception and asked for a sign, the answer was there was none to give. There was no luggage stand so you have to leave it on the floor. There was no Airconditioning although a fan was provided. The night I was staying it was cold and no heating. The hotel is managed by a group of South Asians who didn't seem to be interested in guest satisfaction. The list went on, they made the room rate of 127 GBP a night a ripoff. I have stayed in a much much better hotel in London for less. I advise looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MissPoppyHarriet
Reviews.Content: The Abcone is in a great location just minutes from Gloucester Road Tube station. The hotel is easy to find and from the outside looks very nice. The rooms were very clean and tidy and had everything you needed but were needing a bit of updating (especially the shower rooms which were clean but showed years of wear and tear) Our only problem staying at the Abcone was it was so uncomfortably warm as there's no air conditioning. They did supply a fan but it was pretty useless at cooling the room, unless you stood right next to it. Overall I would recommend as the staff were pleasant and helpful and the location is great but I'd maybe avoid in the height of summer and choose somewhere that has AC.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great value pricewise”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Russman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to tube (gloucester road) 2 minute walk. The rooms are small and the bathroom is tiny (maybe avoid if you're fat as you won't fit!) but be realistic - what hotel rooms in london aren't (bar the uber expensive ones). Could do with some maintenance and fixing up and the beds weren't the most comfortable. BUT - it was very affordable, good location, and good included breakfast. Definitely worth considering

Reviews.Title: “Avoid. Lots of unwelcome suprises to be had as well as very bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: nconnor71
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Abcone Hotel. I was staying for the night before an interview in order to relax and unwind. Firstly there was noise coming from one of the nearby rooms (mainly a TV with some rather loud and foul language being used over the top of it). I woke up and reached for my glasses and they had fallen behind the bedside cabinet. I moved the cabinet to retrieve my glasses and felt something sticky attached to them. To my disgust I found a â€œusedâ€� condom stuck to them!!! I was horrified and felt repulsed. Aren't the rooms supposed to be cleaned? Is this acceptable to you? I am a Christian man and do not want to see things like this particularly when I stay in a hotel. The bathroom also had a few pubic hairs by the loo (disgusting). Added to this the water pressure in the bathroom was pathetic (the tap pressure at the sink was very weak). The shower also did not heat up so I ended up not having a relaxing hot morning shower but a tepid one. This again was unacceptable. The remote control for the TV did not fully work (and was kept together with sticky tape) and the volume had to be altered manually. I complained to the Hotel the next day via email as I was too embarrassed to discuss at a public reception. I did not receive any kind of reply from the Abcone Team and I had to chase up. I received this reply- 1) About the noise and use of foul language from adjacent rooms - Unfortunately the guests cannot be told to speak a certain way or made to watch television at a particular volume. Hence I can only apologise on their behalf. 2) About the bedside stand- There is no space behind the bedside stand. The only space that exists is between the wall and the stand (on one side) and the bed and the stand(on the other side). The room was inspected before and after your stay. Also on the day of your complaint. No evidence of any sticky substance was found. 3) The water pressure and temperature is usually uniform across all the rooms. We did not receive any complaints from any rooms that day and therefore assumed the water pressure and temperature is fine. However it was inspected again and it seemed to be working alright. There appears to be no level of customer service at this hotel. I would avoid as it cost approx Â£125.00 for a one night stay as there are plenty of other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From this Flilthy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshleyFamily
Reviews.Content: I am not picky person & I never take the time to write reviews but this place is so incredibly awful that I would not want my worst enemy to stay there. There was BLOOD on the window coverings and walls near the window. The carpet was so grosse, we did not take off our shoes. Thank goodness I brought Clorox wipes for the bathroom. So much dust that my son had allery attacks. We were all bitten by bed bugs. The hallways smelled like BO from the front desk staff. I picked this place thinking it was a nice middle of the road place, in a great location. LOUD, too so dont plan on sleeping. It makes a motel 6 look like the Ritz. Too bad since it made us really look forward to leaving London.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best.”
Reviews.Author: ingrate
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff struggled with English. The TV didn't work, not that it really mattered as it was comically small. Not all the lights in the room worked. Heat in the room did not work so they gave us a portable space heater! Still, a clean hotel in a good location. However, there is better value out there.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing good is location-otherwise stay away”
Reviews.Author: UsaVisiting
Reviews.Content: Carpet was so filthy with stains it looked like a world map-didn't walk on it without shoes or socks. Previous resident's dirty underwear were still in drawer and a half drunk can of soda was left in mini-bar. Burnt out light bulb and missing light bulb in reading lamps over beds. Only 5 (local) TV stations, no phone book or TV guide in room. Holes in curtain sheers, worn and dirty bed covers. Sheets and towels appeared to be clean. Staff was sort of amiable depending on who you got. Breakfast was so-so. Very expensive for what it is. I would not recommend and will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Eunos1989
Reviews.Content: Firstly this hotel is in a great area. Tube station is a very short walk away and the area is nice. That's where the good bits end unfortunately. The staff who checked us in quickly are not particularly friendly - a 'have a nice stay' wouldn't go amiss. The room was very small (room 18) and was filthy. Judging by the state of the carpet the room was probably used to house cats at some point. The toilet was no bigger than the wardrobe in the room. Credit to the builders who managed to squeeze the toilet and shower in. Thank God I was only staying one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: he1enm
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at the Abcone and I would recomennd this hotel for a short stay.The staff were always very polite and helpful and I was able to leave our bags before our room was ready enabling us to explore the surrounding area which has plenty of restaurants, a Waitrose and a Tesco Express. The room was clean and of an adequate size and the fridge was very useful although it is on the small side. It is in a nice safe area and is a very short walk to the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Abcone”
Reviews.Author: Teri64
Reviews.Content: By phone I booked a twin room for a Monday night, then 2 twin rooms for a Wednesday night and received written confirmation, When we arrived at the hotel they had a booking for the Monday night but not for the Wednesday. There were 2 other people waiting with separate confirmed bookings that the hotel would not honour. The receptionist was very rude and never once apologised. The room was shocking! The beds were small (to accommodate the very small room) mattress's were just cut out 4 inch foam and the carpet was badly stained especially around the edges. the only nice part was the bathroom. We were happy Not to stay a second night.

Reviews.Title: “Short notice weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: A1-WeekendTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected based on price & location for a short notice weekend in London (booked through Lastminute.com). After a long day of travel, museums & other tourist activities, we were both quite pleased with the polite & efficient welcome at reception followed by a clean & comfortable room. We occupied a room on the 2nd floor (at the rear of the hotel) with a double bed and ensuite. Although a little small, as a place for a cheap & simple overnight stop, it was more than adequate. Room facilities included a tv, fan, fridge, kettle, tea & coffe etc, so was appointed to a standard to be expected of any modern hotel room. The ensuite was again very clean; however, although the shower was quite powerful, I could never get any decent hot water! Certainly better than lukewarm & fit for purpose, but not hot. The fan supplied proved useful as there is no air conditioning & the room was quite warm, even with the window open. We were offered use of the restaurant facilities at very competitive prices; however, we simply opted to use the Waitrose & Tesco Express stores conveniently located nearby. The Glouster Road tube station is just a couple of minutes walk (adjacent to Tesco Express) which means quick & easy access to all the major attractions of London. The area around the hotel seemed quite lovely with a good range of restaurants. If staying for longer, this certainly offers a good variety. I would quite happily recommend this hotel for short overnight stops considering the location, price & surrounding facilities. We had no problem with noise from the street or surrounding rooms and the staff were pleasant & helpful with our requests. For the price, I'd certainly be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I stayed in the abcone...”
Reviews.Author: Claire1624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the abcone hotel for 5 nights. We chose the hotel mainly for the location and we were very pleased. The hotel is a 3 minute walk to glouster road tube station which is only a few stops away from the major attractions of London. The area around the hotel has a lovely range of restaurants which we tried on each night. I can thoroughly recommend the wildwood Italian restaurant and green door steak house. The hotel itself is clean. We were given a room on the 4th floor with a double bed and ensuite. The room has a fridge so u can put any food and water in it. There is a tesco express close by. The room is small with a small wardrobe but as we were only in it to sleep and shower it didn't bother us. The room also had a fan and tv. The shower didn't have alot of power and a times was only lukewarm. Breakfast was cereal, a choice of about 4 types, toast an tea or coffee. After a few mornings some yogurt or fresh fruit would have been nice but we were always well fed. I would recommend to stay in this hotel for the location and surrounding facilities and restaurants. We had no problem with noise from the street or surrounding rooms and the staff were pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: JamieT10
Reviews.Content: If you honestly value the comfort of your stay as an important factor, you would do well to stay away from this hotel. I have recently resided there for 3 nights, and each was equally unbearable. There is no air-conditioning system, only a small table fan to give you a dainty breeze. The staff are rude and abrasive, not to mention inappropriate. As I was talking to one of the reception staff about a broken shower knob that only produced burning hot water, he did all but looked up at my face as we spoke. I was extremely offended and felt that he was being seriously perverted. The carpets are dirty, the TV is minuscule and there are no additional facilities whatsoever. They charged us about 165 pounds per night for a standard room, and I'm pretty sure you can get an even better rate and service from the Holiday Inn or Millenium hotel, also situated nearby this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but far too hot!!”
Reviews.Author: shortstuffUk
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Abcone for just one night in June. We wanted a basic but centrally located hotel and that is just what the Abcone offered. The hotel is a 2 min stroll to an underground station from which all of London's main tourist attractions are easily accessable. The room was clean, basic and tastefully decorated. No frills but then you get what you pay for. Our only complaint was the lack of air con. Although the UK doesn't normally get much sunshine, we were staying on the top floor in the middle of a heat wave. We could feel the temperature rising with each flight of stairs we climbed and by the time we got to our room it was like a sauna. The staff did supply us with a fan but it did little to cool the room, even at night. Would happily go back to the hotel but only in the winter months. The room was far too stuffy to get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hotel Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: Dead_Sheep
Reviews.Content: Okay, so let us start with the positives. It is difficult to find a hotel in Central London that does not have 24/7 heavy traffic rumbling past the front window, the Abcone is reasonably set back from the main to avoid this problem. In terms of internal features, my room reasonably sized. The owners had the sense not to undertake the usual activity of using heavy duvets on the beds in hot weather. A nice touch was the inclusion of a coffee perculator in the room as opposed to the norm of providing sachets. Now for the negatives. Firstly, the breakfast was dire. The website claims, "Treat you self to our healthy and organic breakfast service, you'll find a delicious buffet of fresh-baked muffins or organic breads, with perhaps some other hot gourmet treats. There will always be a variety of fresh fruits with Organic yoghurts, granola and sweet orange juice and a selection of teas and steaming coffee, ground fresh with each pot", but in reality, all that was provided was bog-standard Kingsmill bread (I witnessed the delivery), concentrated orange juices and the usual mini-packets of cereals. This hardly met the promise on the website! In the rooms, the carpet was suffering age old dirt and could not have been washed for years. The toilet seat was old and stained in rather perterbing orange and brown colours (I shall leave you to guess the cause). Otherwise, other surfaces and facilities were clean and tidy. The staff were not rude but they were not particularly unfriendly either. They just lacked the knack to welcome guests.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: JustS24
Reviews.Content: Abcone is located in the fabulous Kensington area of London. It is a mere five-minute walk to the Glocester tube stop, restaurants, Starbucks, and a market. For the location, the hotel is a great value. The rooms and bathrooms are very small but this is typical of London. The hotel was clean and the staff helpful. Great stay at Abcone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kelliejane02
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was in a nice area and just a very short walk to Gloucester Road Tube Station. The hotel itself was just right for us - we only wanted a place to put our heads for the night. It was clean and tidy (could do with new carpet) and the staff were pleasant enough. The water took a while to heat up but did work. Our room overlooked the lovely park across the road which was nice. Great pub just minutes away and a few restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3-star hotel in Central London”
Reviews.Author: CRobDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: The Abcone Hotel is located in a relatively quiet street, off the Cromwell Road in Kensington, only a short walk from the Gloucester Road underground station. I chose this hotel as it is within reasonable walking distance of the Royal Albert Hall - it is also close to the Natural History Museum. On arrival, I discovered that the hotel had not received my booking from TravelRepublic, through which I had booked and paid several weeks in advance. The receptionist phoned TravelRepublic, who said they would call back. After 15-20 minutes without a reply, the receptionist gave me the room and said they would resolve the issue with the booking agent later. Needless to say, I will never book through TravelRepublic again. My room was on the fourth floor and there was a nice, modern lift to take me there. The room was very pleasant, with a fresh smell on walking through the door. It was of a reasonable size for a single room, with good quality matching furniture. The room was at the font of the building, with an outlook over the gardens across the road, although the window pane was badly cracked. Tea/coffee facilities were provided and a small old-style television. The bathroom was of a satisfactory standard with a double-shower, but the 'hot' water in the shower was not very warm. Another slight problem was a thin wall with the room next door, through which I could hear a loud telephone conversation which carried on after midnight. Breakfast was served in a basement conservatory, which was pleasant and spacious. However, the Continental breakfast was very basic, with limited choice. In my experience, the Abcone is one of the better 3-star hotels in Central London and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: traveller3132
Reviews.Content: For the price its very good. Close to underground, quite neighbourhood, internet cafe, laundry, many resturaunts in immediate vicinity. Breakfast is really poor. Bathrooms and bedsheets were clean though could see a couple of stains on carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need for a short city break!!”
Reviews.Author: Emzo01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my mum in March. A very pleasant little hotel, in a very pretty and quiet neighbourhood, very near restaurants, coffee shops, internet cafe and tube station, very easy access to any of the city sights. The hotel itself is very clean, I found the staff very friendly but did not interact with them much. It is a basic hotel with internet access. The room met all ones needs, small but not minute, clean bed, wardrobe. Carpet could be replaced, stained,, but clean. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room, a big plus, fridge with soft drinks another plus. TV and desk. Bathroom small but adequate, very clean. Shower clean and running hot water. Breakfast very basic, cereal and toast, pay extra for a full English, free newspaper in breakfast room, which was pretty. Lift available and plenty of brochures and free london maps. Kept bags in a safe room on last day while waiting for our flight. Comfortable, roomy, good price,excelent location, oh very warm and cozy, heating on all day :) I would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Eh... Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: YogaGal28
Reviews.Content: Location is great- lovely neighborhood, close to many sights. However, the staff are poor and unhelpful. Additionally, the hotel is not the cleanest. We also didn't have hot water for our morning showers. We called down to the staff for more information and didn't receive any. Would not stay here again. The walls are also paper thin. You could hear everything in the hallway which was very disruptive while trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, helpull stuff, great location”
Reviews.Author: avsarit
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to me my wife and my 12 years old daughter just according to its reviews in the net. Indeed the rooms are rather small (like in all other London's hotel) and the breakfast is very basic (eventhough it was sufficient). Nevertheless, the hotel is very clean and the stuff are vey welcoming and helpful at any time. If you are looking for a reasonable hotel in good price this is the place for you. It is 5 minutes walk from all the important museums and 10 minutes walk from the Royal Albert Hall and the Hyde Park. One issue is with the hot water in the shower: Need to wait about 10 minutes untill you get them.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lamby1975
Reviews.Content: My second time in a year staying at the Abcone and again had a great stay. Let me keep my bags there as my room wasn't ready. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and the location is awesome. I will stay again next year as I pass through London.

Reviews.Title: “Used this hotel 4 times”
Reviews.Author: BaldersOxon
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel 4 times, its clean, quiet, the staff are helpful, it was my husbands birthday, the staff left a box of chocolates and a birthday card in the room for him, very thoughtful. The hotel is near Gloucester Road underground, museums, supermarkets, restaurants and Hyde Park. If you are British, I would recommend this hotel, Americans are used to a higher standard so bear this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “No sense of hospitality, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: tilly68
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Abcone with high expectations. I expected a very sweet place, but instead found it to be a typical shabby London hotel where there is no sense of customer service. First I was told the room was 20A but it was not even written down, and due to the accent I thought he said, "28" so I went and tried someone else's room! And this was on the third floor! I then returned and got the right room number but my room card did not work. Again up the stairs. I then asked for wireless and was told it was down. I also asked for an iron. I mean, this is supposed to cater for business guests, right? No iron in sight, and finally by 10pm I told them to forget about it; just as well as he had not managed to locate an iron. The room (single) was dark and very basic. If you expect any amenities this is not for you. Shower pressure low. The real surprise was the breakfast; it lists 'organic breakfast' on the website. Do you consider Kellogs packaged muesli as organic... no fresh fruit, no yogurt, we are talking BASIC. The wait staff walked around looking like slobs, wearing sweat suits and no one bothered to come around for tea as I sat for 10 minutes. I decided to leave knowing I'd find something much better elsewhere. Thankfully I left and found a local cafe, thereby forfeiting the included "Organic breakfast" - after getting a glimpse of the scene I did not trust what would come out of that kitchen. The sense of apathy was very high. This is not a place that seems to care about serving or hospitality. Why run a hotel if that is the case? I was very disappointed and would advise not to stay here, unless you really have no expectations and just want a super basic place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rapanhapakko
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in this little peaceful place. The room was big enough for us three, facing a small interior and absolutely no noise from the street. Quite clean exept the spotted carpet and some mold in the bathroom walls. On cloudy weather the room was a bit damp and cold, but got soon warm when the sun shined. The beds were okay and sheets were changed almost every day,and the towels every day. There was always hot water but not cold water in the evenings so we picked some drinking water from the near shop. The breakfast was quite ligh: cereals, toast, cheese and marmelade, orangejuice, milk and coffee. But on the street when walking to the tube there were many places offering food. And an exellent Waitrose-market open from 8 am to 9 pm! The situation was one reason we chose this hotell, a short walk to three tubelines, to many museums and even to Harrods and other big shops. This was very useful during the tubestrike. And silence was important for us too, a good nights sleep made it possible to run all days around the town. The staff was okay and provided everything we asked, but some of them had difficulties in understanding english, for example when asked an extra blanket and sheet we got just two sheets and no blanket at first.

Reviews.Title: “Awful would never stay again or recommend”
Reviews.Author: vicky_lacey
Reviews.Content: Having seen some of the negative reviews of this hotel on trip advisor before booking I was a little put off but have experienced this before and some of the other places I have stayed in have turned out to be very nice. Unfortunately this was not the case here. Me and my partner booked a double room for one night. We arrived at the hotel at around 1.15pm and were told to come back at 2pm as that was check in time (despite the hotel being empty). When we came back we were booked in and went to find our room - a twin room. Having paid three pounds short of Â£100 we went back to the reception and explained we had paid for a double - receptionist was very rude and seemed agitated about changing our room to what we had paid for. Finally got a double but the room itself was disgusting and below basic standards. Stains all over the carpet, we did not have a double bed just 2 singles pushed together the bathroom smelt of sewerage and the sheet on top of the bed looked like it had seen better days. When we later came back from the theatre the hot water wasn't working we had to let it run for 20 minutes only to have luke warm water. In the night the mini-fridge in our room was buzzing so loudly we had to turn it off (after only a few hours sleep because of this I woke up the next day with awful back pain because of how uncomfortable the bed is). When we woke up my partner said he had heard a mouse in the night, which given the state of the place doesn't surprise me. Needless to say we didn't have breakfast there. Overall the 'hotel' was a real let down - yes in London you need to pay hundreds to stay somewhere acceptable but come on there should be basic health and hygiene standards. Good location as so close to the tube but there are other hotels near by that offer better accommodation for the same price- thank god we were only there a night. PAY ATTENTION TO THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS THEY ARE GENUINE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great Position”
Reviews.Author: Bliss984
Reviews.Content: For London standard this hotel is very good especially because of its great position close to a tube station (Gloucester Road), in an excellent district as South Kensington. Rooms and bathrooms are not very roomy but clean and comfortable, always with kettle and coffee/tea supply. Receptionists and breakfast buffet are on average.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sockhead
Reviews.Content: Dodgy has hell! Stayed one night with a colleague last week. Though I got a bargin - Â£59 for a Delux Double with breakfast booked through the hotels own website. If the trip was any longer than an overnighter, we would have booking into the Holiday Inn across the road. I had enamel taps that were painted white with gloss, blood stains (and not small drops - pools) on the carpet, I had to get drunk to brave getting into bed. No hot water either from taps or shower, not good as I had a v.important meeting the next day

Reviews.Title: “1st I book my flight, then I call The Abcone”
Reviews.Author: LondonLoverInUS
Reviews.Content: I have traveled from NY to London over a dozen times since 1987, all of them for pleasure. My first trip I stayed across the street at what was then called the London Forum Hotel through a BA offer. A very nice, but typical 27 story hotel. Knowing that I would be back in London again, I scouted the area for the more 'affordable' and 'quaint' hotel. Spotting The Abcone I noted the address and phone number. Sure enough I had to return to London and I contacted The Abcone to inquire about their hotel, accommodations and rates. Satisfied with my decision I then booked my stay. Now, everyone knows a family run 40 room hotel will not decoratively compare with a 400 room incorporated hotel chain nor compete with its â€˜luxuriesâ€™. But I felt I had found a home away from home feeling I prefer. I was a name not a room number so to speak. The staff and owner were always there on hand. My room was spacious enough for my travel companion and me. The ensuite bathroom was just fine and there was enough space and hot water. Though this is not a modern interior everything was clean, in good condition and in its place. I donâ€™t eat a big breakfast, but do enjoy morning coffee; juice and roll or toast and I chose that over something heavier. There are a few places within a 3-5 min walk to experience how Londoners do a big breakfast. Being a heavy duty sightseer the hotel location was near perfect for me. An ideal base. With short 3/5 minute walk to the Gloucester Road Tube Station with 3 popular tube lines to choose from!! I could easily run back to the hotel to drop off things collected through the day, change clothes, or take a nap. There are plenty of places to dine and shop for essentials and late night snacks. The second time I stayed at the Abcone my brother lost his passport, a travelerâ€™s biggest nightmare. Upon notifying the desk, Ali, the owner called to say he had instructed the staff to have a look for it, provided a photocopy he had taken of his passport, given us the address, phone number, directions to the US Embassy and offered to get us a cab. Over the years Mr. Ali, or his Uncle Rayani, was always there to say a hello. and accomodate guests. This is much of the reason I always stay at The Abcone when in London, and will continue to do so. John LaRock NYC, USA

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, but could be nice with some effort”
Reviews.Author: ShiftyNJ
Reviews.Content: We chose the place based on the description on the hotel website. They clearly had some good marketing people that chose the best aspects to highlight. It looks pleasant enough from the outside, part of a block of typical London town homes (I believe this hotel was originally two homes). Our room was on the second floor facing the back. There is a lift but it is very small, clearly an afterthought, and two people and luggage won't fit. We used it as a dumbwaiter for the bags and walked the stairs ourselves. Our room was probably once a bedroom when it was a private home, but the bathroom and the lift shaft were carved out of the original space so it was the size of a large bathroom, smaller than our stateroom on the ship we had just disembarked. There was just enough room to get in the door and circumnavigate the bed. The furniture was modern-ish and sensible and the bathroom, though quite small, was beautifully tiled (obviously added later) and sparkling clean. However, the carpet in the room itself and mattress pad were both grubby. The website calls the breakfast "organic" or "gourmet", I forget which, and claimed it was included but that was a little ambiguous. Full English breakfast was optional/extra. The included breakfast was a adequate but spartan Continental setup. The space where it is served is very pleasant greenhouse-ish room on the basement level. Service is perfunctory at best. In summary, if you want someplace relatively inexpensive (for London, which is -- in general -- outrageously overpriced) in a convenient area (a block from the very pleasant Waitrose supermarket and tube station) this is a tolerable choice but don't expect what you see on the website unless they've done some cleaning and attitude adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty damn awful”
Reviews.Author: Tal1976
Reviews.Content: Tiny room without even enough space to open my suitcase, awful shower with no water pressure, poor quality mattress and bedding, and TV was only a 14 inch. Then there was breakfast, ok there was cereal and milk, and they would even bring you toast, but the additions to this were jam or processed cheese slices. For the price I think they should invest more in the cleanliness of the hotel and quality of the rooms. There is NO excuse for poor showers and cheap mattresses, when you can stay at a Holiday Inn for the same money and get a consistently high service. Basically, if you want to feel like you're paying 100 pounds a night for a hostel room, go for it, otherwise, don't bother staying here until they sort it out.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in london”
Reviews.Author: metou
Reviews.Content: Great hotel . Friendly stuff. More than you expect from a London Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: maxxxxi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night in a twin room. The room was clean and nice but quite small. The bathroom was nice and clean. Staff were friendly. There wasnt much room for suit cases in our room. It is a good place to stay if you can get a room for a decent price and if you are only staying a few days. If you are staying longer you may want a bigger room so you'd have more space, especially if 2 of you are sharing. It is in a great central location, near the tube, buses and taxi rank near by. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lynne185
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Abcone Hotel for 2 nights September 2008. The location is perfect being 1-1/2 blocks from Gloucester Road tube station but on a quite side street. Nearby were plenty of restaurants and a supermarket. I had a single ensuite room which was quite small but adequate with everything needed by the single traveller. When in London you don't spend much time in your hotel room! It was quiet, clean, secure with TV, tea/coffee making, mini bar and a fan. Continental breakfast was served in the basement and included in the tariff of 55 GBP booked online direct to hotel. I reckon I got a bargain. My flight out was at 10:15pm and the hotel happily stored my luggae for the day after I had checked out. In my opinion - the perfect hotel for single travellers of any age.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: gcalestani
Reviews.Content: As a group leader of 13 Italian tourists, I stayed at the Abcone in June 2007; we were pleased with our stay. The location is perfect: just 3/4 mins' walk to Gloucester Road Tube Station, the area is very quiet. Rooms and bathrooms are clean. Breakfast a little bit poor and ... starts at 8:30am on Sundays! (had to leave withour having breakfast, which was a bit disappointing). On the whole, it is good value for money and I would recommend this Hotel. I will certainly stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “quite a relief!”
Reviews.Author: Queenie2008
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for a suitable hotel for a small group of ladies celebrating birthday weekends on a medium budget. Just after booking a couple of quite negative reviews appeared here and I was a bit worried! However, we had a great stay. Plus points: Rooms were all clean, and looked fairly recently furnished. Triples were large, Doubles more compact but still fine for a couple of nights. Soft drinks in minibar were Â£1 each, yes, more expensive than shops, but cheaper than most other london hotels I've stayed in! All our rooms had nice powerful showers, some over bath, some walk-in. We were able to store our luggage for several hours before and after our stay. The receptionist let us check into our rooms early (tho obviously this will just depend on if they have been vacated early and cleaned) Breakfast was available until 10:30 on Sunday, and was adequate for us (Juice/coffee/cereal and plenty toast). Only 200 yards from Tube and Taxi Rank. Several pubs/bars/cafes/supermarkets available in a 5 minute walk, and only 10 mins walk to the V&A, Natural History and Science museums. Quiet side-street location rather than facing directly on the busy Cromwell/gloucester Rds. Room for Improvement: The water never seemed to run cold, which wasn't too pleasant for tooth brushing. The website mentioned a bar but, when we arrived there wasn't one. I thought it was my own mistake, but checking again it's still mentioned (although the main page with picture of it is gone). We were obviously a bit disappointed, but there was a large bar under the monsterous looking holiday inn next door and several shops so you could buy your own for late night consumption without feeling guilty! I think overall that it is of the same or higher standard to other london hotels of the same price - they are all expensive for what they are, but for anything cheaper you are probably going to book 6 months in advance, very last minute or stay in a youth hostel, all fine at times, but not always possible! Both myself and other members of the group agreed we'd be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: esizemore
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel from living next door in college. We decided to stay there since I was familiar with the area. It is right behind the Gloucester road tube station so you have immediate access to public transportation and can be anywhere in minutes. The hotel is small, clean, quiet and very accommodating. When My husband and I checked in, we realized that I had booked us in two twin beds. the hotel was very accommodating and changed our rooms for us. then, when we went to Normandy for the weekend, they let us store our bags there for a minimal charge rather than having to take them with us. For those who complain about small rooms, I think they have not traveled in Europe much. the rooms here were a bargain for the price! I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend...”
Reviews.Author: il-baritono
Reviews.Content: How should one take a shower when the water is boiling hot and the thermostate broken and there's anyway no cold water at all?Maybe that this is a typical London Hotel illness,but this is not the free ticket for the Hotelliers not to do anything about it.The phone plug was broken,tv and hairdryer ok,as well as the furniture,but a dirty carpet could not convince me to like it,though the price was ok.Thin walls,not really a place to get some sleep. Be aware:no light on the nightstand,nor on the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: siobhÃ¡n
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked to stay here for 2 nights but changed at the last minute to just 1...I'm glad we did! The room was an OK size but was a bit shabby. The carpet was stained and around the skirting boards and behind the bed clearly hadn't been vacuumed since, well, ever! There was also no hot water in the shower. I guess for the price though you can't really complain too much and the location was good

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor cleanliness & unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LindylouDublin
Reviews.Content: Loved the location 3 mins from Glochester tube station, it was also on Big Bus Tour route, the room was what I would expect for the price, though on arrival towels smelt (I suspect maybe room was dormant for a couple of days, towels were hung over an opened toilet bowl thou grand after that) and bed was made with clean sheets but with a old fashioned blanket, one bed had a cover which was swiftly taken off, no air conditioning (window opened) and got quite warm at night, a continental breakfast was included in our stay so when we asked for toast we did not expect to be charged for a English Breakfast at check, but they did take it off the bill. Information leaflets in the hotel were out of date, a whats on guide detailed Nov 07 activities and when we enquired about a bus tour we were presented with a leaflet so glad we had done our own research. It is in a beautiful area and for minimal changes this has the potential to be a little treasure.

Reviews.Title: “On a quiet street in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JuneHawaii
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a quiet side street in a residential area which gave it a restful feeling. But it is only 1 block to the Piccadilly Underground and shopping district. The room was on the small side and the bathroom on even the smaller side. But everything was very clean, and fresh-looking & lots of hot water. The entire room was lit by a huge window that opened! Ideal room for a short stay. We skipped the hotel breakfast and walked around the corner to a neighborhood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: Piggle_EH
Reviews.Content: Our stay was booked through laterooms this is the email I sent them the morning after our visit. It isn't often that I feel the need to complete a feedback form, and I cannot remember the last time I truly complained however, having just had my worst stay ever in a hotel anywhere in the world I feel the need to tell you about the Abcone Hotel, 10-11 Ashburn Gardens, London SW7 4DG. This is supposed to be a three star hotel so although I didn't expect anything really flashy I did expect a comfort and level of service worthy of a professional hotel. I booked on Tuesday 03 October and we stayed last night. The hotel boasts the following facilities amongst others: Satellite TV/ In-House Movies â€“ If you try to watch anything other than the terrestrial channels it asks you to insert your Sky Card. Room service (24 hours) â€“ However, I have no idea what room service was offering since there was no menu in our room, or mention of room service facilities Wake Up Service â€“ Only if you ask for it â€“ it wasnâ€™t offered. Health Club â€“ No idea where this was â€“ again nothing in the room to indicate where you were supposed to go. Hotel Parking â€“ If you delve a bit deeper this is advertised as Private Parking - This is my main reason for complaint. As stated when I made my reservation we needed a late check in. So as it was Central London I deliberately opted for a hotel with parking. In fact, upon arrival we were told â€œthere is free parking in the street outside until 8:30am. You canâ€™t park in our car park it is closed!â€� I found this a bizarre situation and complained that the street outside was completely full and we needed to park, we had stated we would be late arriving â€“ had nobody thought it a good idea to contact us and tell us the situation with parking. The aggressive, rude receptionist then told me that he would take me to the car park and arrange to get our car in â€“ it would cost Â£30.00, at the Holiday Inn across the road! I had assumed that as the details on the website said that there was hotel parking, and didnâ€™t note an additional charge that it was free onsite parking. He then went on in pigeon English to try to explain the concept of Inclusive versus Exclusive to me; which frankly by this time I was in no mood to hear and it bears no relevance to the circumstances. I am extremely angry that we were duped in this way â€“ faced with Hobsonâ€™s choice; wait for a parking space outside and move early in the morning, pay Â£30.00 to park in another hotelâ€™s car park or go elsewhere and forfeit Â£135.00 for a room you donâ€™t use. We were lucky a parking space became free but it did mean we had to leave earlier than we needed to this morning. Breakfast - A continental breakfast was supposed to be served this morning; it consisted of small boxes of cereal and toast, little pots of jam and slices of processed cheese still in their individual plastic wrappers. According to the website you can have â€œbreakfast to goâ€� but when you ask for it your toast is handed to you in a scrunched up serviette and you have to fill your pockets with the jam. No orange juice or water is given to you â€“ just a handful of toast! Hardly a three star menu or the superior service promised. There was a nice little balcony outside our window; used to house the green floodlights that lit the front of the building â€“ and our room. I finally managed to drift off to sleep around 6:30am when they went off! Without a shadow of a doubt we will remember our stay at the Abcone for many years to come. I hope this feedback is of some use to you. Although this review did appear on the Late Rooms website for a very short time it quickly disappeared!

Reviews.Title: “Quite adequate”
Reviews.Author: goldenflight
Reviews.Content: The Abcone Hotel is situated in Kensington, a nice area of London, close to Gloucester Rd tube station, a nice variety of eateries, supermarkets, Royal Albert Hall, Hyde Park and the Natural History, Science and V&A museums, We had a double room which was nothing fancy but quite adequate for the time we spent there. The bathroom was clean though very small. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels and tea/coffee delivered daily. There was a small fridge with drinks. We didn't partake so can't say how expensive they were. In the mild October we had, it was necessary to keep windows open during the day. It was okay to close them at night without overheating. As a light sleeper, I was relieved the hotel was located at the quiet end of the street away from noisy Cromwell Rd and that we were not bothered by noise in the hotel itself. The biggest disappointment was the "organic" breakfast. A small selection of cereals, processed sliced pan toasted and cheese slices in individual wrappers are hardly organic or even acceptable as a selection for breakfast. The serving staff were busy and rather sullen and annoyingly wearing high heels on wooden floors. One busy morning (about 14-18 people) we arrived for breakfast and while we found seats ok, we were told there were no cups or cutlery left! We were left to scavenge some unused ourselves from uncleared tables. Cooked breakfasts were available for an extra charge. When we visited much of the paintwork in our room was chipped and the TV had a fault which meant it switched off then on again every five minutes or so. The reception staff weren't terribly friendly. On some websites, I notice it says you can check in here at 11am. We tried to but were told it would be 2pm at least. .We were able to leave our bags though before check-in and also after check-out which was good. We tend to magnify the bits that annoy us but, on the whole, we were reasonably content with the hotel especially the location. We were out most of the day so, apart from the disappointing breakfasts, it was fine for our purposes for a couple of days sightseeing. We were on a tight budget and our deal worked out about Â£80 or so a night but I wouldn't like to pay more for what we actually got.

Reviews.Title: “OK For A Night”
Reviews.Author: F0rest
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as attending a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. Walking time to the RAH is around 20 minutes so it is convenient for that. The Abcone is a clean well maintained hotel which served the purpose quite well. I had a single room which was very hot, even with the window open and the bathroom was the smallest I have ever come across. Fat people could not use the toilet or the shower. I found I could not sleep because of the heat and the heating was turned off and window was open. Noise from outside the hotel was also a big problem at night. The breakfast is very basic, cereals and orange juice and toast with processed cheese. I am sure they could do better here. Reception staff were unable to help with basic questions, he had never heard of the Albert Hall. Next day there was a girl on reception who could not tell me how to get to Chelsea. My son also stayed in a single room which was more spacious and had a much bigger shower room so it is the luck of the draw with which room you are given. I would consider this hotel again for a one night stay but would want a different room.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: a&ssussex
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Abcone after a show at the Albert Hall and location is great for that - about 10 mins walk max. the reception staff were friendly and helpful - they let us in the room way before the check in time . the room was spacious and spotless with a decent shower. nice and quiet in a fairly residential area but near bars/restaurants for a night out. but the breakfast really let it down, a couple of sullen waitresses who half cooked the toast and that was pretty much all there was on offer except cereal - i had to go in the kitchen and ask if i could have tea as only coffee was out on the 'buffet' table and the staff were pretty indifferent (not sure you could really call it a buffet continental breakfast - think they were being a bit liberal with the truth there) but overall not bad value for the money

Reviews.Title: “what a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: ibasaw
Reviews.Content: This is such an expensive hotel for what it is providing! paid Â£300 for three nights stay when its only worth half the price! this is purely a rip off. Silly of me to book direct through the property but even then its not decent to charge in such extreme. what a start of my europe trip, to feel so rip off! breakfast is not visiting. better to get it off gloucester road. just don bother with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location - quiet”
Reviews.Author: Kulta
Reviews.Content: Was situated in a really quiet area, but only a quick walk to tube, pub, cafes and shops. Hotel was a bit dated but very clean. We had breakfast in the hotel the first day but it was only mediocre so went out after that as Cafe Paul was only down the road and really good. The price was the clincher for this hotel. Best value as London can be so expensive, all we wanted was a nice, clean room that we'd be able to have a good night's sleep and not be ripped off. That's what we got.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideOzzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights. Great location for London base. Short walk to underground Gloucester station & top cafe for breakfast. The room was very small, not even enough room to lie our suitcases on the floor. The drain in the shower did not drain away. The bathroom was a good size. Luckily there was a fan provided in the room which we had turned on at all times. We had an opening window but it was still quite hot inside. The room was fairly clean & was kept stocked with tea/coffee supplies. NB this hotel even provided "real coffee" & perculator machine! We had a small bar fridge which was great for keeping up the food supplies. Didn't eat breakfast in the hotel but it was advertised for a very reasonable price by London standards. Plenty of shops including supermarket & restaurants nearby so you won't go hungry. The hotel was very quiet & located directly across the road from a major hotel chain hotel. All in all a pretty average hotel but ideally located & close to transport.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leelee8574
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, reception staff friendly and helpful, room was plenty big enough,( we have had much smaller both in London and other areas ) nice comfortable bed, tv, tea coffee making facilities plus a mini fridge ( which they will keep topped up with cold drinks at an extra charge if required ), carpets had small stains, but this is due to negligent guests spilling things rather than any fault of the hotel, towels changed daily, tea, coffee, milk, soap and shampoo replaced on a daily basis, walking distance to the museums, harrods, gloucester tube couple mins away, dont know what breakfast was like as we took the opportunity over the weekend to have a lie in, rather than get up for breakfast ! On the day of departure, they look after your luggage free of charge which was a big help as we were travelling late at night so still had the day free to go sightseeing. Overall, we had a very comfortable stay, and will definately book this hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: HockeyDr
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised! Very much booked to a budget for 3 nights and concerned after what I had got for a similar price in Earls Court 2 years ago but it was fine. Yes the room is small, but they do come smaller! It was clean, newish furniture with a comfortable bed, sparkling bathroom. A perfectly good place to sleep: who wants to spend the day in their hotel room in London? Niggles: The water refuses to run cold so drinking water has to go via the fridge, the carpet had seen better days, the breakfast was basic but what do you expect at this price point? Reception staff were helpful and stored a huge sports bag for me whilst I travelled elsewhere for a reasonable charge and nil once we had booked in. Literally 2 minutes walk to the 'tube'and direct to Heathrow Airport, so an excellent location just a few stops from the West End. I would stay there again and pocket the savings to spend elsewhere in London.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: kayt1
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic price, clean, fan in room..really handy! Would use again, breakfast ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Olympia”
Reviews.Author: AnneDM
Reviews.Content: Good location near tube station and handy for exhibitions. Clean and friendly. Very good value breakfast - only Â£2.95 for continental or Â£3.95 for English! Nearby Waitrose for drinks etc. and lots of restaurants nearby. Quiet location for London.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mghtlh
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the size of the room from the pictures they show you. My husband and I could barely move around each other in the tiny room we were given. Carpet was absolutely filthy and they didn't even vacuum every day. Bathroom, while small, was modern and the shower was hot and strong but tile grout was beginning to mold and mildew. Could hardly get down the very narrow hallways for the linens laying on the floor every day. On a positive note, the staff was friendly but not too knowledable about the city and the extra pillows I requested arrived immediately. Furniture was clean and modern and had a nice wardrobe for clothing. Excellent location and neighborhood. Glouster Road tube station is 2 blooks away and good choice of inexpensive (if anything in London can be called that) restaurants in the neighborhood. Grocery store also very close. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in South Kensington”
Reviews.Author: nankerphelge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a wonderful 6 days at the Abcone Hotel. We had arrived at 8:30 AM after an overnight flight from San Francisco. Our room wasn't ready ( as expected) but they said they would have it ready as soon as they could. After going to breakfast, we returned at 10:30 AM. We were then told our room was now ready and that we were welcome to check in early. This was very nice of them as we were quite tired. The rest of our stay was great, and everyone was always more than helpful. Any requests were taken care of right away ( extra pillows, ice, etc.) The room was clean, though much smaller than most rooms here in the States. But we knew that going in so we weren't surprised. Having visited London one time a few years back, I wanted to stay in South Kensington, and this stay at the Abcone was all I could have hoped for. I just hope that with too many good reviews, they don't raise their prices! London's not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jen F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best budget hotel that I have ever stayed at in London.... and I have stayed in a lot! The hotel is 30 minutes exactly from heathrow international terminal 3 with no line changes! The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly! Funny too! The price was fabulous for London. 89 GBP per night for a very spacious family room ( we were 3 adults, 1 four- year old).. 2 twins and a king bed with a remarkably clean spacious bathroom. Loads of wardrobe space and a huge window with a private balcony. Great continental breakfast, very clean and quiet. Also, they have internet access in the lobby for a very good deal. Very quiet and 2 blocks easy walk to the Glouchester road tube station, a really safe residential neighborhood with a boots drugstore, waitrose market, pubs and the like all within a block. we walked to chelsea and V & A museum in 20 minutes, easy walk. I will definitely return and tell everyone I know about this fine hotel. Stay at The Abcone! You will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: teacher66
Reviews.Content: I am an Italian teacher (evening classes) and I stayed at the Abcone Hotel from the 2nd to the 6th of February with a group of 15 adult students. I had booked after browsing the internet site of the hotel and reading some reviews of previous guests on tripadvisor. I didn't expect to find such a nice hotel. The staff are very friendly and helped the group when they were in trouble (for instance with the room key), everybody was satisfied with their room and their breakfast. The hotel is quite modern and in a very quiet area of London, if you need to eat something quick and cheap there are several places nearby where you can enjoy a meal and the most important thing when you need to visit the town - the tube station is really 10-minute walk from the hotel. The price for the group was really cheap. I am recommending the hotel to my friends and I'll be back on my next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming and Cramped? Tell Me About It!”
Reviews.Author: Brian&Suzie
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night, and to call it cramped and dirty, would be an understatement. The bedroom window looked as though the glass would fall out with a gentle breeze. A pane appeared to be glued together. There was no hot water in the bathroom, and you had to practically sit on the toilet when you wanted to use the basin. The bed was a mere 6" from the wall at the base, which meant clambering over the bed to reach the far side. Unfortunately we missed breakfast (due to a missunderstading at check in) Reception were very blunt and said "I told you breakfast finished at 9.30".......No offer of a bowl of cereal, cup of coffee or even a fruit juice! There was a workman sat at the reception desk chatting (no work going on in the hotel?) and he had a cup of coffee???? The hallway floors were covered in clean sheets and towels for the 24 hours we were there! I truly feel they took our money under false pretences. Right is right and wrong is wrong and this was definately very wrong. Hope they are happy with our well earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel404
Reviews.Content: Carpet Was Filthy, Bathroom ceiling leaked water, Two twin mattresses pushed together to make double bed, Small room, Had to walk sideways to get into small bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: ioneann
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews of Abcone Hotel was dreading our stay. The hotel was well presented, the hotel staff were helpful and our room was faultless. We had a spacious room, lovely decor, well fitted out and equipped with hot drink facilities, hairdryer and a fan. The bathroom was tiled floor to ceiling in marble .The only drawback, if there was any, was that the breakfast was fairly basic, cereal and toast, but hey thats all you have at home. Would recommend as a good budget priced hotel in a lovely position in Kensington. Ione and Steve Gibbons, Saddleworth UK

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from two-night (personal funds) weekend stay, following three previous days in business class hotel. I regret paying the 65 pounds/night (for regular single), as the value proposition at even that level was minimal. Stiflying hot third floor room (while outdoor temp were friendly low 20s), no a/c, disgusting cheap mattress with no padding/cover against its annoying buttons and threadbare sheets, "organic" breakfast of Kelloggs boxed cereal, toast and bland coffee... Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am an American living in the UK and travel to London quite alot, every hotel has been cramped and dated. I had a friend and her young daughter visit from the US and we stayed in the Abcore Hotel for 3 nights. It was wonderful, what a change from all the tiny budget hotels in London! We booked the family deluxe room at an unbeatable price of Â£285 a night, thats half the price it would have cost for 2 rooms anywhere else. Our room had 2 single beds and one double bed, we also had a cot in our room for an infant, with plenty of room to spare for luggage and space for the kids to run around at the end of a long day. Only room we could find like this, 3 adults and 2 kids comfortable in one room! Absolutley could not believe how big the room was, especially in London. Location was great too, short walk from Glouester Road tube station which is on the Circle and District line so its extremely easy to get to where you want to go. Quiet street, we had the windows open at night. Friendly staff, we arrived well before check in and were told as our room had been empty the night before we could go ahead and put our bags in our room. Didnt sample the breakfast as we were up and out too early in the morning. Only complaint would only be our problems with booking, you will only have this problem if using a Switch/Maestro card. As they have no way to validate the card unless they charge you for 1/2 one nights stay and then credit it back to your acct. But staff was very friendly and happy to help. I would reccommend this hotel to families or groups that dont want/cant afford 2 rooms at a time. Very impressed, already planning to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as reviews might lead”
Reviews.Author: Wil21
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Abcone Hotel for 2 nights. I was in a group of four people so we got 2 rooms. My room was one of the basement rooms. It was small, but not that bad. The bathroom was nice, and there was plenty of hot water. The other room was upstairs and was smaller than mine, but similar in condition. The beds were only ok, a little hard for my liking. The self serve breakfast for 3 pounds was pretty good and consisted of toast, cereal, juice, coffee, tea, etc. (I did not try the full English breakfast). The staff was friendly enough, although they did try and charge us for a few extra breakfast's, so beware. Overall, I would say the hotel was fine for what we paid. It is in a good location, 2 blocks from the Gloucester Road tube station, and in a good neighborhood. That said, I would most likely not stay there again, as on the end of our trip we stayed in a much nicer hotel, for not much more money (see best western mostyn).

Reviews.Title: “Worried but positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: GoofyBoi
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the reviews here at Tripadvisor I kind of regretted that I had booked a stay at Abcone Hotel. We arrived very late a Friday night and were kind of expecting the worstâ€¦ Luckily we had booked a deluxe room which was tiny for being such a room however spotless and very clean - even the bathroom was sparkling. Nothing to complain about when it comes to cleanliness and the beds were also very comfortable. Most of the complaints here at Tripadvisor are referring to the size of the room but you simply canâ€™t compare a Victorian building in central London with a modern hotel anywhere in the world; Victorian hotels usually have small rooms. I find Abcone well suited for a weekend-trip to London but if youâ€™re carrying tons of luggage and are in need of loads of space I would recommend you to stay somewhere else. Personally I would stay here again if the price is right. /Peter, Stockholm, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was clean and is in a good location. What you would expect for the reasonable price. But, I will never stay there again and for one reason. They are dishonest. We checked out of our room and the man proceeded to tell us we owed almost 80 pounds for telephone and mini bar use. We never touched the mini bar - not once. We did use the phone but checked out our calling cards with TWO front desk staff to make sure they were free to call out. The front desk attendent told us that there was nothing he could do and offered to take 25 pounds in cash and wipe the record clean. I refused this - there is no record of cash transactions! Plus, we did not use any of the services we were being charged for. He was rude, telling us to be more careful next time! It was an awful experience and I would hate for anyone else to have these same mystery charges on check out.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL! No cold running water.”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle30
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel! There was no cold water for 3 days in a row, only very very hot. Had to wash my face with a bottle of mineral water. The elevator was broken for those 3 days. I laughed out loud when i saw the size of my room. It was a bed, a wardrobe and a desk crammed into a closet-sized room. On the up- side the price was good - 2 nights for a single room was Â£90. But only go to the Abcone if you are really stuck!!

HotelInfo.Name: Abcone Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 10 Ashburn Gardens, London SW7 4DG, England
